intro: Coccoloba rigida, commonly known as the prickly coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, often spiny leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are thick and waxy, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Coccoloba rigida is often used in landscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental appearance.
